title: How can AI perform on the edge?
description: What are the capabilities, constraints, and benefits of running AI models of edge devices?
author: Ryan Donovan
excerpt: What are the capabilities, constraints, and benefits of running AI models of edge devices?
text: March 5, 2025What are the capabilities, constraints, and benefits of running AI models of edge devices?Ryan chats with Clark Jarvis, Senior Staff Technical Marketer at Infineon, and Alexander Samuelsson, CTO at Imagimob, an Infineon Technologies Company, to talk about the capabilities, constraints, and benefits of running AI models of edge devices. They discuss the various tools that let them optimize models for edge devices, how the ecosystem is maturing to support more use cases, and how low code can help simplify the number of domains you need expertise in to run AI on the edge.Episode notes:Infineon is a global semiconductor company for power systems and IoT.You can connect with Clark and Alexander on LinkedIn.Congrats to Lifeboat badge winner hdsenevi for their answer on Unrecognized font family 'Roboto' - React Native iOS.
html:
March 5, 2025

What are the capabilities, constraints, and benefits of running AI models of edge devices?

Ryan chats with Clark Jarvis, Senior Staff Technical Marketer at Infineon, and Alexander Samuelsson, CTO at Imagimob, an Infineon Technologies Company, to talk about the capabilities, constraints, and benefits of running AI models of edge devices. They discuss the various tools that let them optimize models for edge devices, how the ecosystem is maturing to support more use cases, and how low code can help simplify the number of domains you need expertise in to run AI on the edge.

Episode notes:

Infineon is a global semiconductor company for power systems and IoT.

You can connect with Clark and Alexander on LinkedIn.

Congrats to Lifeboat badge winner hdsenevi for their answer on Unrecognized font family 'Roboto' - React Native iOS.
